CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 9, 1974, pg. 15 reads: "Friends Overflow - Bon Voyage Willa Mae - Friends from many stations in life filled the vestry of Wesley Center AME Zion Church recently to extend best wishes to Mrs. Willa Mae Rice, extreme right, who is one of 40 outstanding American Church Women taking part in a caravan of peace to war-torn areas in Far East, Feb. 1 to March 3. Others in the picture, left to right are, Alexander Anderson, father of the honoree; Bob McCall, president of the Black Caterers; Mrs. B.J. Hopson, Mrs. Alberta Harrington, general chairperson; Rev. B.J. Hopson, executive secretary of the Allegheny-Union Baptist Association; Mrs. Eva Hoggard of Indianapolis, Ind., supervisor of the Sixth Episcopal District.  AME Zion Church and Mrs. Irene Glenn, co-chairperson. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, including Raymond Rice and Willa Mae Rice in front, Eva Hoggard, third from right, and Alexander Anderson, father of Willa Mae Rice, in back on right, standing around table for a Bon Voyage party for Willa Mae Rice with model airplanes, banners and posters, at Wesley Center A.M.E. Zion Church
